paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on genetic variants in the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with SQT1 at age 28 after experiencing syncope.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diagnosed with SQT1 after presenting with palpitations.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 was diagnosed with SQT1 at age 31.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic despite carrying the variant.
Patient P4 was evaluated at age 29 and found to be asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: The N588K mutation in KCNH2 leads to increased IKr current, contributing to the pathophysiology of SQT1.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected family members.
variants.population_frequency: Not available in gnomAD or ExAC.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on functional assays and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the need for personalized medicine approaches in treating SQT1.
key_quotes: The SQT1 mutation N588K in KCNH2 is associated with increased risk of arrhythmia.
Patient P1 was diagnosed with SQT1 at age 28 after experiencing syncope.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
